question.title: How to resolve protobuf dependency conflicts when using Milvus Java SDK with Spring Boot
question.body:
NoClassDefFoundError caused by protobuf dependency conflict when using Milvus Java SDK in a Spring Boot project

I’m integrating the Milvus Java SDK (Milvus 2.x) into a Spring Boot application, and I’m running into a dependency conflict related to protobuf-java.

My project already depends on several third-party libraries, some of which bring in their own versions of protobuf-java. To avoid conflicts, I tried excluding all protobuf-related dependencies from my project and relied only on the version provided by the Milvus Java SDK.

However, during application startup—when the Milvus client is being initialized—the following exception is thrown:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/google/protobuf/Message
    at io.milvus.client.MilvusServiceClient.<init>(...)

According to the dependency tree, the effective protobuf version at runtime is:

com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java:3.25.5

This issue occurs consistently across multiple Milvus 2.x versions, not just a specific release.

What is the recommended way to manage the protobuf-java dependency when using the Milvus Java SDK in a Spring Boot project, so that runtime errors like NoClassDefFoundError can be avoided?
